content:
CodeNamespaceCollection Class

In this Article

Represents a collection of CodeNamespace objects.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterface(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ClassInterfaceType.AutoDispatch)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public class CodeNamespaceCollection : System.Collections.CollectionBase

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.Collections.CollectionBase
  • CodeNamespaceCollection

Inherited Members

,

,

Remarks

The CodeNamespaceCollection class provides a simple collection object that can be used to store a set of CodeNamespace objects.

Constructors summary

CodeNamespaceCollection()

Initializes a new instance of the CodeNamespaceCollection class.
CodeNamespaceCollection(CodeNamespace[])

Initializes a new instance of the CodeNamespaceCollection class that contains the specified array of CodeNamespace objects.
CodeNamespaceCollection(CodeNamespaceCollection)

Initializes a new instance of the CodeNamespaceCollection class that contains the elements of the specified source collection.

Properties summary

Item(Int32)

Gets or sets the CodeNamespaceCollection object at the specified index in the collection.

Methods summary

Add(CodeNamespace)

Adds the specified CodeNamespace object to the collection.
AddRange(CodeNamespace[])

Copies the elements of the specified CodeNamespace array to the end of the collection.
AddRange(CodeNamespaceCollection)

Adds the contents of the specified CodeNamespaceCollection object to the end of the collection.
Contains(CodeNamespace)

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection contains the specified CodeNamespace object.
CopyTo(CodeNamespace[],Int32)

Copies the collection objects to a one-dimensional Array instance, starting at the specified index.
IndexOf(CodeNamespace)

Gets the index of the specified CodeNamespace object in the CodeNamespaceCollection, if it exists in the collection.
Insert(Int32,CodeNamespace)

Inserts the specified CodeNamespace object into the collection at the specified index.
Remove(CodeNamespace)

Removes the specified CodeNamespace object from the collection.

Constructors

  • CodeNamespaceCollection()

    Initializes a new instance of the CodeNamespaceCollection class.

    public CodeNamespaceCollection ();

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to create an empty instance of the CodeNamespaceCollection class. 

             // Creates an empty CodeNamespaceCollection.            
         CodeNamespaceCollection^ collection = gcnew CodeNamespaceCollection;

                // Creates an empty CodeNamespaceCollection.            
            CodeNamespaceCollection collection = new CodeNamespaceCollection();

            ' Creates an empty CodeNamespaceCollection.            
        Dim collection As New CodeNamespaceCollection()
  • CodeNamespaceCollection(CodeNamespace[])

    Initializes a new instance of the CodeNamespaceCollection class that contains the specified array of CodeNamespace objects.

    public CodeNamespaceCollection (System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace[] value);

    Parameters

    • value
      CodeNamespace[]

      An array of CodeNamespace objects with which to initialize the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      One or more objects in the array are null.

  • CodeNamespaceCollection(CodeNamespaceCollection)

    Initializes a new instance of the CodeNamespaceCollection class that contains the elements of the specified source collection.

    public CodeNamespaceCollection (System.CodeDom.CodeNamespaceCollection value);

    Parameters

    • value
      CodeNamespaceCollection

      The CodeNamespaceCollection with which to initialize the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      value is null.

Properties

  • Item(Int32)

    Gets or sets the CodeNamespaceCollection object at the specified index in the collection.

    public System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace this[int index] { get; set; }

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the collection to access.

    Property Value

    • CodeNamespace

      A CodeNamespace at each valid index.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The index parameter is outside the valid range of indexes for the collection.

    Remarks

    This property is an indexer that can be used to access the collection.

Methods

  • Add(CodeNamespace)

    Adds the specified CodeNamespace object to the collection.

    public int Add (System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace value);

    Parameters

    • value
      CodeNamespace

      The CodeNamespace to add.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index at which the new element was inserted.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the Add method to add a CodeNamespace object to a CodeNamespaceCollection instance. 

             // Adds a CodeNamespace to the collection.
         collection->Add( gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace" ) );

                // Adds a CodeNamespace to the collection.
            collection.Add( new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace") );

            ' Adds a CodeNamespace to the collection.
        collection.Add(New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace"))
  • AddRange(CodeNamespace[])

    Copies the elements of the specified CodeNamespace array to the end of the collection.

    public void AddRange (System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace[] value);

    Parameters

    • value
      CodeNamespace[]

      An array of type CodeNamespace that contains the objects to add to the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      value is null.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the AddRange(CodeNamespaceCollection) method overload to add members of a CodeNamespace array to the CodeNamespaceCollection. 

             // Adds an array of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
         array<CodeNamespace^>^namespaces = {gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace1" ),gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace2" )};
         collection->AddRange( namespaces );

         // Adds a collection of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
         CodeNamespaceCollection^ namespacesCollection = gcnew CodeNamespaceCollection;
         namespacesCollection->Add( gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace1" ) );
         namespacesCollection->Add( gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace2" ) );
         collection->AddRange( namespacesCollection );

                // Adds an array of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
            CodeNamespace[] namespaces = { new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace1"), new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace2") };
            collection.AddRange( namespaces );

            // Adds a collection of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
            CodeNamespaceCollection namespacesCollection = new CodeNamespaceCollection();
            namespacesCollection.Add( new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace1") );
            namespacesCollection.Add( new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace2") );
            collection.AddRange( namespacesCollection );

            ' Adds an array of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
        Dim namespaces As CodeNamespace() = {New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace1"), New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace2")}
        collection.AddRange(namespaces)

        ' Adds a collection of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
        Dim namespacesCollection As New CodeNamespaceCollection()
        namespacesCollection.Add(New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace1"))
        namespacesCollection.Add(New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace2"))
        collection.AddRange(namespacesCollection)
  • AddRange(CodeNamespaceCollection)

    Adds the contents of the specified CodeNamespaceCollection object to the end of the collection.

    public void AddRange (System.CodeDom.CodeNamespaceCollection value);

    Parameters

    • value
      CodeNamespaceCollection

      A CodeNamespaceCollection that contains the objects to add to the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentNullException

      value is null.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the AddRange method overload to add CodeNamespace objects from one CodeNamespaceCollection to another CodeNamespaceCollection. 

             // Adds an array of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
         array<CodeNamespace^>^namespaces = {gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace1" ),gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace2" )};
         collection->AddRange( namespaces );

         // Adds a collection of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
         CodeNamespaceCollection^ namespacesCollection = gcnew CodeNamespaceCollection;
         namespacesCollection->Add( gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace1" ) );
         namespacesCollection->Add( gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace2" ) );
         collection->AddRange( namespacesCollection );

                // Adds an array of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
            CodeNamespace[] namespaces = { new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace1"), new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace2") };
            collection.AddRange( namespaces );

            // Adds a collection of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
            CodeNamespaceCollection namespacesCollection = new CodeNamespaceCollection();
            namespacesCollection.Add( new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace1") );
            namespacesCollection.Add( new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace2") );
            collection.AddRange( namespacesCollection );

            ' Adds an array of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
        Dim namespaces As CodeNamespace() = {New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace1"), New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace2")}
        collection.AddRange(namespaces)

        ' Adds a collection of CodeNamespace objects to the collection.
        Dim namespacesCollection As New CodeNamespaceCollection()
        namespacesCollection.Add(New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace1"))
        namespacesCollection.Add(New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace2"))
        collection.AddRange(namespacesCollection)
  • Contains(CodeNamespace)

    Gets a value that indicates whether the collection contains the specified CodeNamespace object.

    public bool Contains (System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace value);

    Parameters

    • value
      CodeNamespace

      The CodeNamespace to search for in the collection.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the CodeNamespace is contained in the collection; otherwise, false.

    Example

    The following example uses the Contains method to find a CodeNamespace object in a CodeNamespaceCollection. 

             // Tests for the presence of a CodeNamespace in the collection,
         // and retrieves its index if it is found.
         CodeNamespace^ testNamespace = gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace" );
         int itemIndex = -1;
         if ( collection->Contains( testNamespace ) )
            itemIndex = collection->IndexOf( testNamespace );

                // Tests for the presence of a CodeNamespace in the collection,
            // and retrieves its index if it is found.
            CodeNamespace testNamespace = new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace");
            int itemIndex = -1;
            if( collection.Contains( testNamespace ) )
                itemIndex = collection.IndexOf( testNamespace );

            ' Tests for the presence of a CodeNamespace in the collection,
        ' and retrieves its index if it is found.
        Dim testNamespace As New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace")
        Dim itemIndex As Integer = -1
        If collection.Contains(testNamespace) Then
            itemIndex = collection.IndexOf(testNamespace)
        End If
  • CopyTo(CodeNamespace[],Int32)

    Copies the collection objects to a one-dimensional Array instance, starting at the specified index.

    public void CopyTo (System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace[] array, int index);

    Parameters

    • array
      CodeNamespace[]

      The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the values copied from the collection.

    • index
      Int32

      The index of the array at which to begin inserting.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The destination array is multidimensional.

      -or-

      The number of elements in the CodeNamespaceCollection is greater than the available space between the index of the target array specified by the index parameter and the end of the target array.

    • ArgumentNullException

      The array parameter is null.

    • ArgumentOutOfRangeException

      The index parameter is less than the target array's minimum index.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the CopyTo method to copy the contents of a CodeNamespaceCollection object to an array, starting at the specified index value. 

             // Copies the contents of the collection beginning at index 0,
         // to the specified CodeNamespace array.
         // 'namespaces' is a CodeNamespace array.
         collection->CopyTo( namespaces, 0 );

                // Copies the contents of the collection beginning at index 0,
            // to the specified CodeNamespace array.
            // 'namespaces' is a CodeNamespace array.
            collection.CopyTo( namespaces, 0 );

            ' Copies the contents of the collection beginning at index 0,
        ' to the specified CodeNamespace array.
        ' 'namespaces' is a CodeNamespace array.
        collection.CopyTo(namespaces, 0)
  • IndexOf(CodeNamespace)

    Gets the index of the specified CodeNamespace object in the CodeNamespaceCollection, if it exists in the collection.

    public int IndexOf (System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace value);

    Parameters

    • value
      CodeNamespace

      The CodeNamespace to locate.

    Returns

    • Int32

      The index of the specified CodeNamespace, if it is found, in the collection; otherwise, -1.

    Example

    The following example searches for the presence of a specific CodeNamespace and uses the IndexOf method to retrieve the index value at which it was found. 

             // Tests for the presence of a CodeNamespace in the collection,
         // and retrieves its index if it is found.
         CodeNamespace^ testNamespace = gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace" );
         int itemIndex = -1;
         if ( collection->Contains( testNamespace ) )
            itemIndex = collection->IndexOf( testNamespace );

                // Tests for the presence of a CodeNamespace in the collection,
            // and retrieves its index if it is found.
            CodeNamespace testNamespace = new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace");
            int itemIndex = -1;
            if( collection.Contains( testNamespace ) )
                itemIndex = collection.IndexOf( testNamespace );

            ' Tests for the presence of a CodeNamespace in the collection,
        ' and retrieves its index if it is found.
        Dim testNamespace As New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace")
        Dim itemIndex As Integer = -1
        If collection.Contains(testNamespace) Then
            itemIndex = collection.IndexOf(testNamespace)
        End If
  • Insert(Int32,CodeNamespace)

    Inserts the specified CodeNamespace object into the collection at the specified index.

    public void Insert (int index, System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace value);

    Parameters

    • index
      Int32

      The zero-based index where the new item should be inserted.

    • value
      CodeNamespace

      The CodeNamespace to insert.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the Insert method to insert a CodeNamespace object into a CodeNamespaceCollection. 

             // Inserts a CodeNamespace at index 0 of the collection.
         collection->Insert( 0, gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace" ) );

                // Inserts a CodeNamespace at index 0 of the collection.
            collection.Insert( 0, new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace") );

            ' Inserts a CodeNamespace at index 0 of the collection.
        collection.Insert(0, New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace"))
  • Remove(CodeNamespace)

    Removes the specified CodeNamespace object from the collection.

    public void Remove (System.CodeDom.CodeNamespace value);

    Parameters

    • value
      CodeNamespace

      The CodeNamespace to remove from the collection.

    Exceptions

    • ArgumentException

      The specified object is not found in the collection.

    Example

    The following example demonstrates how to use the Remove method to delete a CodeNamespace object from a CodeNamespaceCollection. 

             // Removes the specified CodeNamespace from the collection.
         CodeNamespace^ namespace_ = gcnew CodeNamespace( "TestNamespace" );
         collection->Remove( namespace_ );

                // Removes the specified CodeNamespace from the collection.
            CodeNamespace namespace_ = new CodeNamespace("TestNamespace");
            collection.Remove( namespace_ );

            ' Removes the specified CodeNamespace from the collection.
        Dim namespace_ As New CodeNamespace("TestNamespace")
        collection.Remove(namespace_)
